title: Customer Service Officer (Call Center) Job at Mactay Consulting
content:
Mactay Consulting, We are the leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning & Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Officer (Call Center)

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Brief
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Customer Service Officers (Call Center) you will be required to provide excellent customer service to the company's subscribers by answering inquiries, resolving complaints, offering product information, and assisting with account management through phone calls, emails, or live chat, while adhering to company's standards and achieving set performance metrics like call resolution rates and customer satisfaction levels.


Responsibilities


	Answering customer calls regarding billing issues, service inquiries, product information, account updates and complaints.
	Identifying the root cause of customer problems, providing solutions and ensuring timely resolution within company’s guideline
	Actively offering relevant organization products and services to customers based on their needs and current plan
	Accurately documenting customer interactions, including details of inquiries, complaints and resolutions in the CRM system
	Maintaining high levels of customer service by meeting established quality metrics like call handling time, first contact resolution and customer satisfaction
	Keeping up to date with the latest company’s products, services, policies and system updates ti provide accurate information to customers


Requirements and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in any field of study.
	0 - 1 year of working experience.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong listening and problem solving abilities.
	The ideal candidate must have completed NYSC
	Knowledge of customer service principle and practices.


Salary
Open.

title: Human Resources / Admin Officer Job at Ekiti Agro-Allied International Cargo Airport
content:
The Ekiti Agro-Allied International Cargo Airport is a new airport in Ekiti State, Nigeria, designed for both cargo and passenger flights. It received approval for non-scheduled flight operations in December 2024, with the aim of boosting the state's economy and facilitating the export of agricultural products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources / Admin Officer

Job Location: Ekiti

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To be responsible for and proactively drive the design, development, and effective delivery of training to the organization's employees within defined timescales
	Liaising with HODS and interviewing employees at all levels to identify and assess training and development needs
	Explaining and providing information on employee benefits, programs, and education


Qualification/Job Specifications


	B.Sc. in any Social Sciences. CIPM will be an added advantage.
	Minimum of 2 years of post-qualifications


Skills and Competence:


	Ability to work with extremely confidential & sensitive data
	Teamwork
	Time management
	Conflict resolution
	Good Leadership skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a certificate of Local Government of Origin to: jobs.airport@ekitistate.gov.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Only qualified candidates should apply.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Supply Officer Job at Action Against Hunger
content:
Action Against Hunger is the world’s hunger specialist and leader in a global movement that aims to end life-threatening hunger for good within our lifetimes. For 40 years, the humanitarian and development organization has been on the front lines, treating and preventing hunger across nearly 50 countries. It served more than 21 million people in 2018 alone.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Supply Officer

Job Location: Maiduguri, Borno
Reporting to: Logistics and Supply Chain Manager
Proposed start date: July 2025

Key responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure procurement is processes according to the project's PPP;
	Handle supplies in accordance with the appropriate procedure
	Handle orders in accordance with ACF procedures;
	Organize and manage PDs in LINK
	Prepare the necessary documents related to the order: Supplier Purchase Order, Delivery Note, etc;
	Check the accuracy of the information on all documentation;
	Ensure that all required validations are completed prior to procurement.
	Maintain and develop a supplier database into LINK
	Ensure that ACF policies (Gender and Safeguarding, etc.) are well understood by suppliers
	Inform logistics and programs of their supply progress
	Conduct market reviews to find new suppliers;
	Develop good relationships with suppliers;
	Negotiate prices with suppliers
	Keep LINK up to date with all relevant suppliers and market information;
	Ensure that all elements of procurement files are complete in LINK;
	Ensure that all procurement related documentation is carefully archived (Procurement Files,DN) electronically and physically in the archive room. 
	Ensure warehouse team is well informed of deliveries to receive;
	Ensure that invoices contain the required information in accordance with ACF procedures;
	Ensure the update of procurement files with corresponding invoices;
	Ensure advance of cash is use and close according to the procedures of the finance department;
	Coordinate with the finance department to ensure proper follow-up of supplier payment.
	Complete and maintain the Contract Monitoring follow up;
	Complete and maintain the supply minutes.


Position Requirements


	Minimum Bachelor degree/HND or equivalent 
	Min 2 years of experience in procurement and/or logistics position
	Some experience in supervising Staff
	Strong computer skills in MS Office, especially MS Excel
	Rigorous, with strong organization skills and attention to detail
	Strong communication skills
	Strong negotiation skills
	Strong Integrity
	Professional level of English
	Ability to work in complex environment and can bear the work load
	Previous experience working for NGOs an asset, particularly international and/or Nutrition-health, WASH and FSL related NGOs.


Note


	Our employees enjoy a work culture that promotes diversity and inclusion
	Action Against Hunger does not charge any fee at any stage of the recruitment process (application, interview, processing)
	Action Against Hunger provides Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.
	Other benefits include but are not limited to 100% health care coverage, free and direct access to Cross Knowledge e-learning platform.
	Women at ACF are entitled to benefits such as maternity leave, compassionate leave for a hospitalized child, and creche facilities for babies and toddlers.
	All candidates MUST ensure they answer all the questions asked for this application. Failure to do so means candidates will not be considered for the process.

title: Investment Advisor Job at Mshel Homes Limited
content:
Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Investment Advisor

Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary 


	We are seeking a results-driven Investment Advisor to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying and securing new real estate investors, educating clients on investment opportunities, and providing expert advice that ensures long-term value for both the client and the company.


 Key Responsibilities 


	Identify and engage potential investors through various channels.
	Promote the company’s real estate investment products (e.g., land, housing units, off-plan projects).
	Provide detailed and customized investment advice based on clients’ financial goals.
	Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to achieve company targets.
	Ensure full compliance with regulatory and company investment policies
	Maintain a pipeline of prospective investors and follow up regularly to close deals.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with individual and institutional investors.
	Conduct market research and monitor trends in real estate and investment sectors.
	Prepare and present investment proposals and sales pitches to clients.
	Maintain accurate records of investor interactions and transactions using CRM tools.
	Maintain long-term relationships with clients by providing periodic updates on investment performance, new offers, and additional property opportunities.
	Address client inquiries, resolve complaints, and ensure excellent post-investment support.
	Keep accurate records of investor interactions, agreements, and transactions.
	Prepare periodic reports on sales performance, market feedback, and client satisfaction.


  Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Finance, Business Administration, Real Estate, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in investment sales, real estate advisory, or financial consulting.
	Strong understanding of real estate market and investment principles.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and client relationship skills.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and work ethic.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; familiarity with CRM software is a plus.


Key Competencies:


	Investment analysis
	Real estate market knowledge
	Sales and business development
	Client advisory and support
	Strategic thinking and problem solving
	Presentation and persuasion skills


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.
	Work in a dynamic and innovative real estate company
	Access to exclusive investment and tools
	Positive work environment 


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: mshelrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as subject of email.
